info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 3:29AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 102 AND 106 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON AND TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE BRAZOS VALLEY WILL APPROACH 103 DEGREES... The upper level high pressure remains overhead, helping to increase temperatures throughout the day. High temperatures will reach the triple digits for most locations north of I-10 and the Brazos Valley could approach 103 degrees this afternoon. Areas south of I-10 will reach the mid to upper 90s, but the sea breeze pushing through in the afternoon could make heat index values climb a little further. Overall, heat index values will reach 102 to 106 this afternoon across Southeast Texas. Heat-related illnesses and deaths are preventable, and all heat safety precautions should be taken even if there is no Heat Advisory in effect. Stay in air-conditioned locations as much as possible. Wear light colored, lightweight and loose fitting clothes. If outdoors, avoid strenuous activity and stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water. Take frequent breaks from the heat. Never leave children or pets unattended in vehicles as interior temperatures can reach lethal levels in just a matter of minutes.
